meanings.definition: To swallow up or overwhelm completely.
meanings.sent1: The giant wave was ingulfing the tiny boat.
meanings.sent2: The darkness seemed to be ingulfing the entire room.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was ingulfing its food so fast, it almost disappeared!
meanings.sent4: The loud music was ingulfing her thoughts, making it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent5: The flames were ingulfing the old building, creating a terrifying sight.

meanings.sent1: The thick fog was ingulfing the mountain, hiding it from view.
meanings.sent2: The warm blanket ingulfed her in a cozy embrace.
meanings.sent3: The vines were ingulfing the old house, giving it a mysterious look.
meanings.sent4: The crowd ingulfed the performer, cheering loudly.
meanings.sent5: The sandstorm was ingulfing the entire desert, creating a surreal scene.

meanings.sent1: She loved ingulfing herself in a good book on a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: The diver was ingulfed by the deep blue sea.
meanings.sent3: The kids were ingulfing each other in a playful water fight.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the flowers ingulfed the garden, filling the air with sweetness.
meanings.sent5: The warm bath was ingulfing her in relaxation after a long day.
